This video has been augmented
with Popcorn Maker!
Much of Beau's work explores human perception
Watch this frog on Youtube
Beau is a Doctor of Philosophy

He is a member of the Vision Network
Research Group at
University College London

Stuart Brown: 
"Plenty of play in childhood makes for happy, smart adults -- and keeping it up can make us smarter at any age. "

"It is paradoxical that many educators and parents still differentiate between a time for learning and a time for play without seeing the vital connection between them.” 
- Leo F Buscaglia
"Play-based learning can take a key role in the teaching of science and can encourage scientific enquiry skills" - Robert Sinclair

Early Childhood News:
"Promoting the development of scientific thinking"
Visit Blackawton School

Watch the TED talk
"Evolution's Gift of Play, from Bonobo Apes to Humans"

Why Teaching Science is Important:
whyscience.co.uk

Teaching Times: 
Primary schools lack quality science teachers

A New Challenge for Teachers: 
Encouraging Girls in Science, Math and IT Related Studies and Careers

"A survey of over a thousand 8–11 year-old children in primary schools indicated that children in the more senior classes showed a marked decline in their enjoyment of school science. " - Association for Science Education

"49% of all co-ed maintained schools in England do not send even one girl on to do physics A-level" 
- Institute of Physics

Watch a video about Lottolab's
iScientist program for youth

Why Science Is Vital
scienceisvital.org.uk

Watch a video of Beau and
the students conducting research

Linkedin Profile of
Dave Strudwick
Read the full paper here
"Knowing the right answer ... is not one of the primary objectives of science in the early childhood curriculum..."
“Knowing the right answer requires no decisions, carries no risks, and makes no demands"
"A far more important objective is to help children realize that answers about the world can be discovered through their own investigations." - Eleanor Duckworth
How to Write a Scientific Paper
Larry Maloney

Read the commentary paper by 
Natalie Hempel de Ibarra and 
Laurence T. Maloney
Read the final published article
Article in The Guardian
Article in Discover Magazine
Article on BBC.co.uk

"Why Play is vital,
no matter what your age"
TED 2008, Stuart Brown

The Centre for Education in Science and Technology:
Importance of science in schools
"It is human to have a long childhood"

"it is civilized to have an even longer childhood."
 - Erik Erikson
Some studies have shown that investment in girls education raised the GDP of the entire country by 0.2%
Children of women who have completed primary school are 40% less likely to die before age five
An extra year of primary school boosts girls’ eventual wages by 10 to 20 percent. An extra year of secondary school: 15 to 25 percent

To discover more about Dr. Beau Lotto's work
visit lottolab.org

What the world feels now about #uncertainty:

Scientific American:
"So you think you know why animals play"

Dr. Beau Lotto is a professor
at University College London
in the Department of Opthamology

Beau is also the Head Misfit
and founder of Lottolab.org
